ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this class to another student.Summary: The basics of glass blowing methods and techniques. Starting with scoring/cutting and melting glass with a torch, working all the way up to joining pieces together in different ways, reshaping glass forms and fixing cracks/chips.

You learn how to handle glass and build simple projects. The course focuses on teaching you techniques that you would use very frequently in building scientific glassware. Highly recommended to anyone who is able to take the course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I am better able to assess damaged laboratory glassware, and decide what can be fixed and what is better replace. I learned how to seal samples under vacuum and how to fix and/or make simple glass pieces.Although this is unlikely to have much impact during my doctorate, it may be very helpful in the future as a researcher somewhere that might not have a person like Daryl on hand.

I have a better understanding of the glassware that I use in my research every day, from the simple to the complicated. On top of that, if I ever need custom glassware for a particular purpose I have a better idea of what is needed and what can be done.
